titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the Joe Menosky papers, 1983-2005, (bulk 1995-2001) LSC.2250
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Rachel Barnes with assistance from Julie Graham, 2010; machine-readable finding aid created by Caroline Cub√©.

p.date: Online finding aid last updated 23 August 2017.

address.addressline: Room A1713, Charles E. Young Research Library

publicationstmt.p: Finding aid description and metadata in this record are licensed under a Creative Commons Public Domain Designation (CC0 1.0 Universal). See LSC's Metadata Rights Statement for more information.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-10-31 12:48:32 -0700.

change.item: Added MMSID, Processing Notes, metadata RD (CC).

did.unittitle: Joe Menosky papers
did.abstract: Joe Menosky is a writer, producer, and story editor who has worked in both television and film. He is best known for his work in science fiction, most notably the television series Star Trek Voyager. The bulk of collection consists of material for produced and unproduced television projects and motion pictures as well as items submitted to Menosky for consultation. Additionally included are articles by Menosky and a small amount of ephemera and publications related to the Star Trek franchise.
did.physloc: Stored off-site. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use and Reproduction
userestrict.p: Property rights to the objects belong to UCLA Library Special Collections. All other rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Joe Menosky Papers (Collection 2250). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived user interest and research value, availability of staff and resources, and competing priorities. Library Special Collections provides a standard level of preservation and access for all collections and, when time and resources permit, conducts more intensive processing. These materials have been arranged and described according to national and local standards and best practices.

Collections are processed to a variety of levels depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived user interest and research value, availability of staff and resources, and competing priorities. Library Special Collections provides a standard level of preservation and access for all collections and, when time and resources permit, conducts more intensive processing. These materials have been arranged and described according to national and local standards and best practices.

We are committed to providing ethical, inclusive, and anti-racist description of the materials we steward, and to remediating existing description of our materials that contains language that may be offensive or cause harm. We invite you to submit feedback about how our collections are described, and how they could be described more accurately, by filling out the form located on our website: Report Problematic Content and Description in UCLA's library collections and archives.

bioghist.head: Biography/History
bioghist.p: There is little biographical information available about Joe Menosky. Joe Menosky is a writer, producer, and story editor who has worked in both television and film. He is best known for his work in science fiction, most notably the television series Star Trek Voyager.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of material related to the career of story editor, writer, and producer, Joe Menosky. The collection includes script materials related to produced and unproduced motion picture and television projects, including items submitted to Menosky for consultation, articles written by Menosky, and a small quantity of publications and memorabilia related to the Star Trek franchise. Among the many projects represented are Anonymous Rex, Dead Like Me, Tomb Raider, Star Trek IX, Star Trek Resurrection, and Star Trek Voyager. A small amount of files and publications may have been assembled by production assistant, Michael O'Halloran.

arrangement.head: Organization and Arrangement
arrangement.p:
Arranged in the following series:
Television Projects
Motion Pictures Projects
Submissions to Menosky/Informal Consulting
Articles by Menosky
Publications and Memorabilia

did.unittitle: Television Projects

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The television projects files contain complete and partial draft scripts, story outlines, series and story proposals, a small amount of production material. Among the projects in the series are Anonymous Rex, Dead Like Me, and Star Trek Voyager. Files are arranged alphabetically by project and file tiles.

did.unittitle: Submissions to Menosky/Informal Consulting

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The bulk of the series includes story outlines, notes, and script material for a variety of projects submitted to Menosky for consulation. Includes Star Trek IX, Star Trek Enterprise, Star Trek Nemesis, and Star Trek Resurrection, among others. The series is arranged alphabetically by project title.
